thread.title: Trip of the week: Iceland and Greenland
thread.title_full: Trip of the week: Iceland and Greenland

title: Trip of the week: Iceland and Greenland
text:
By Cindy Decker Dispatch • Sunday July 26, 2015 5:00 AM 
Each week, Travel Editor Cindy Decker highlights an interesting travel package sent to her inbox. 
Iceland and Greenland: In the Wake of the Vikings 
ABERCROMBIE & KENT, 1-800-554-7094, www.abercrombiekent.com 
THE TRIP: This 12-day Arctic cruise and photographic expedition aboard the MV Le Boreal follows the routes taken by Vikings such as Erik the Red across the Atlantic. 
Guests will explore the volcanically active Westman Islands, also known as “Mount Fire” and home to huge colonies of Atlantic puffins. 
In Greenland, a day will be spent cruising Skjoldungen Fjord. In the southern fjords, boats will land along Prince Christian Sound. 
Guests will also visit Eriksfjord, where Erik the Red had a farm, and Brattahlid, site of the first Christian church in the Western Hemisphere. 
THE COST: from $10,495 double occupancy
